data.text: The game is constantly disconnecting, even after uninstall reinstall. My home wifi is stable, the game is unstable. It's next to unplayable. Not to mention the number of micro transactions, there are so many. You can not get legendary heroes for free. They need to add a way to limit who can join your rally. You should be able to block players under a certain power from joining when you are trying to fight a big monster. It's almost impossible to kick w/ rejoining. There are no ads at least.
data.replyText: Dear Commander, please contact our in-game support with your game issue and details (eg UID, time/date of issue, supporting screenshots/video references) and we'll assist to check it out thank you! We are also gradually adding legendary heroes into the recruitment pool too! If you have any other suggestions/feedbacks feel free to let us know~

data.text: The graphics are nice, pretty polished. The ux is cluttered, and there are tons of things to click on and lots of ways to spend money... BUT, the actual game play is boring as hell. It's so basic and automatic that it takes ZERO thought or skill. You slide your little people left and right, and THAT'S IT. You don't even have to think. You just move them to the blue lane. It feels super non-interactive for as busy as it is. Feels like a weak attempt to disguise the money pit it's drooling to be.

The game is cool and fun to play. The reason for the 3 stars is the extremely long time it takes to build/upgrade. If you plan on playing this game w/ no money or minimal money spent, I wouldn't waste my time. Taking 2, 3, 4+ days to upgrade a building or training soldiers is wild. You spend more time waitin for upgrades/training than playing. I feel the building/training speed could be decreased so ppl spend more time playin rather than waiting. Will change my review if this improves.
data.replyText:
Dear Commander, we are sorry to hear that you had a poor experience in our game.
We are striving to improve our gameplay for all players and would greatly appreciate if you could contact us via our in-game support to leave us feedbacks or suggestions, thank you in advance!

data.text: Fun game but highly predatory constantly pushes "deals" or "value buys" in your face with no way to turn those things off. It's game with pay to win mechanics that has a free to play option, which makes being able to participate in the events of the game impossible. By the time a free to play player is able to do anything, most of the people they know will have left the game and moved on. Would give less stars if I could
data.replyText:
Dear Commander, thank you for your review.

Please do look forward to our future game updates!
If you have any suggestions or feedbacks for improvement feel free to contact us via in-game support and we'll be happy to hear them out!

data.text: The screenshots of the game (what's shown in ads) is probably less than 5% of the game. And it's no where near what they show. Main game is building a base behind artificial time gates. You can play for a couple of hours before you are forced to a halt behind long build times and progress becomes non existent unless you pay for boosts.
data.replyText:
Dear Commander, we're sorry to hear you had a bad experience.
We hope to improve overall player experience and your feedbacks are greatly appreciated! If you have any suggestions or feedbacks for improvement feel free to contact us via in-game support and we'll be happy to hear them out!

data.text: Very difficult to make progress without spending money. I bought a few basic packs to speed things up. One week ago, I was looking at a pack, went to payment page but didn't buy it. Came back a few hours later and $21+ was deducted from Google Play account. I thought it was a glitch. So, I went back to that page. They deducted same amount again. $2.12 left on my account. I wonder if they kept stealing my money every time I was looking at that pack... Useless Customer Service. Filthy thieves...
data.replyText: Dear Commander, please contact our in-game support or via email at lastwar.dev@gmail.com with your account info and details (eg UID, purchase receipt screenshots) and we'll assist to verify as soon as we can thank you in advance!

data.text: Don't start this game unless you want to pay thousands of dollars to keep playing. The game is highly interactive but there is really no story or purpose or end... you just keep playing until you dont want to invest any more money into it. There is no end to upgrading anything as well. Too many moving parts- I found myself more exhausted than enjoying the game. I've slowed down a lot and i have also stopped spending money. Its also really buggy, especially the survivor section.
data.replyText:
Dear Commander, thank you for the review.
We are constantly introducing new events and gameplay optimization for our players, do look out for our future game updates! If you encounter any bugs/issues etc feel free to contact our game support for assistance!

data.text: if you're free to play, after the first couple of days it just becomes an app you open every few hours then click a few things then close. Then a few hours later, open, click, close. As others have said, what they advertise is maybe 10%? of the game. At the begging of the game you'll play a few of those types of games, then you'll get to a point where you're not strong enough to advance and need more resources to level up (then the open, click, close starts). Then get stronger, then repeat

data.text: I'm leaving only 2 stars for many different reasons, this game is honestly good for the first hour but then quickly shows all of its cons. I first downloaded the game because of the ads making it look appealing, then I started to see that this game is trying to be like too many other mobile games like Rise of Kingdoms, Top War, and some of those tower defense style games. I feel like this game doesn't even know what style game it is. I would keep going but only allowed 500 letters. ðŸ˜¤

data.text: This game was fun for maybe 2 weeks and now it is the most boring game I think I've played. It's like you hit a wall of being able to do anything in the game not to mention the pictures and ads are not at all how the game works only a small part of it. Once you get past the first ladder of missions and unlock your full base you quickly see how boring it gets. You also get to an inevitable point where your troops aren't high enough level to do any of the missions or any of the events.

If you have any suggestions or feedbacks for improvement feel free to contact us via in-game support and we'll be happy to hear them out!

data.text: Nothing about this game is skill based and thats what irks me the most. Its all a matter of having strong enough troops for the level which often means having to purchase additional characters, resources or having to wait snd grind for a long, long time just to progress 3-5 levels and get stuck in the same loop again. All the busy tasks you can do while you grind and can't beat a real level are incredibly boring. Just click here , click there , claim this claim that, just boring as hell.

data.text: They will call you "Commander" and apologize. I wanted to play the left/right multiplier game in the ad. You get to do that RARELY. Most of what you do is collect "Heros" and upgrade buildings. After about 15 minutes of building your pase, you get entered into a multiplayer world where pay to win is the expectation. It's a beautiful expression of addiction mechanics in action. But it is not a good use of time. I am NOT a "Commander", Rivergame.

The game is the one from the add so that's good and overall it's a pretty good game with great graphics. Really my only problem with it is that it is so slow. There is barely any action. You get to do a couple of battles before your heroes are outmatched and you have to upgrade a bunch of things which takes a long time. You can pay to boost it and improve this but that would still only get you a few more battles before you'd have to do it again. Not worth it

data.text: It was great until the events started picking up. The app keeps shutting down and kicking me offline, and since this is a time based game, these glitches will cost you opportunities and resources that you have to spend even more time to get back. It's fun, but it's frustrating. Oh, and support is almost non-existent. If you write them about a problem it'll take DAYS to get a response and the response is pretty much, "we're sorry to hear that" then nothing is done.
data.replyText:
Dear Commander, thank you for the review.

data.text: Pay to play base building game w/ timers. levels that you see in the advertisement where your shooting is only a small part that you mabye spend less than 5% of the time. playing a month never seen the levels in the pics. most of the battles you just watch really and if your not strong enough ...wait longer or spend a few more bucks ... this one will get old quick ...it would be so much better if they had way more of the levels in the ads sucks thats the main ad but only a small part.

data.text: Edit: fun game, but one slip of the finger and you can accidently spend all your premium gems instead of your free speed-up items. I almost dropped my phone and lost over 2,000 of the premium red gems while catching my phone. And I only wanted to use the free boosters for that research. I don't want to spend money on a game where an accident can cost real money.

data.text: Horrible game!!!! I'm sick and tired of games that show a completely different game in its ad than what it is!!! This game is a rip-off. You can't progress in it because higher lvl players treat you as a farming tool than actually farming locations on the map. This game is a "build your base up" type of game. Not what they show any of their ads. There is very minimal game play like they show in their ad.

data.text: Can be irritating. Building up and learning the game is fun. However, if you join an active alliance, you will hit a point when you stop receiving rewards for your efforts. If you spend money on the game itself, and your HQ level isn't at a certain point, you will achieve rewards that aren't given to you. So you can see what you won, but don't have access to. I still enjoy the game because of the people I play with. But it is annoying as (insert expletives here). P(L)AY if u want 2B deprived.

Fun to kill some time but around level 11 it starts to take days for your base to upgrade. It is designed as pay to win game. I've been in alliances where they spend hundreds of dollars a week, every week. There's no skill required. Team that spends the most money, gets upgrades faster and stays dominant. Sleazy but I'm sure developers love it.

data.text: Game is a boring cash grab. It's fun for the first few hours then it's basically just a waiting game. There is no replayability. Once a level is beat that's it. No going back to play again. You honestly can't progress without waiting hours, some times days, not exaggerating, to "power up" enough to start having fun again. Or you can always spend cash. This game is for whales. Don't waste your time unless you want to waste your cash.

data.text: After seeing a hundred ads saying, "it's ACTUALLY like the ads!" I decided to try it. It's just a stick figure running in a straight line, making math-based choices to level up the squad, right? It's nothing like the ads. There's levels kind of like that, but it's not a casual game about quick math, it's build your fort so you can build up your heros so you can play another level so you can build up your fort. A few hours in and already several hours of construction between unlocking a stage.

data.text: Starts out great, then loses its appeal. The beginning of the game is great! Leveling up and creating the base, but after you start leveling up, it takes way to long to continue. It literally takes HOURS to level up the units within the base and takes a lot of effort to upgrade your team. I get things take time, but 24 hours to level up you home base...that's unplayable. Would be 5 stars if didn't take so long to level up everything!
data.replyText: Dear Commander, we're sorry to hear you had a bad experience. We will strive to improve our gameplay content for our players. Please do look forward to our future game updates! If you have any suggestions or feedbacks for improvement feel free to contact us via in-game support and we'll be happy to hear!

data.text: The ads are lies. I wanted to run down the road and shoot stuff like the videos show. You spend very little time doing that, and the levels are extremely short. You spend 95% of your time upgrading your base and units and going in and out of nested menus collecting boxes of stuff you can never use up because it takes forever to upgrade anything. Absolutely boring, very little action.
data.replyText: Dear Commander, thank you for your review You may experience the gameplay featured on our ad in 'Special Operations', which is part of our game's gameplay. We are constantly introducing new content for our players so please do look forward to our future updates! If you have any suggestions or feedbacks on improving our game we're happy to hear too.

data.text: Misleading in-game offers. Like most free-to-play games there are many things you can buy to enhance gameplay but they are not clear on what you receive. Example: Initially you are limited to 1 building upgrade at a time. After paying to "permanently enable build queue" you'd expect to be able to queue up multiple upgrades. Wrong. Your "queue" will have a limit of 2, unless you upgrade again for 4x more. Not sure what the limit would be with another upgrade. Not going to find out.

The game starts out very fun but around level 11 it slows down like crazy. Everything takes sooooooo long to upgrade and it just gets worse with every level after that. The game is made in a way to get you addicted to it, so then you spend tons of real money on in-game purchases in order to speed up the process of upgrading. I don't mind in-game purchases for $1 or $2, but most packs here are worth between $20 and $100!!! Who in their right mind would spend that much on a mobile game??

Ads looked cool, so I downloaded it. Ads account for about 25% of the game. I gave it 3 weeks and about $5 to get an early boost. The various events are cool and keep things interesting, but it's not worth my time anymore. Make the attacks competitive, and the game would be tremendously better. There's no point in letting Level 120 pay-to-play whales attack newbie peons. Do better! Ciao.

data.text: Game play is primarily about building up a base. You are encouraged to join an alliance nd help the team. Different than the ads, not bad just different. Unfortunately, a few things ruin the experience. After a few levels, game play really slows down. It takes hours or days to upgrade buildings and research new tech. The rules encourage bullying behavior. Stronger players are rewarded for attacking weaker ones. Could be a much better game with as few adjustments.

data.text: I'm all for upgrading kind of games, but there is the element of grind. The ads shown are only a small part. It gets to a point where it's not about skill but how strong your characters are. Upgrading does take too long like others have said. Level 7 is where I started noticing I just had to login, select which building to upgrade and then stop playing until that was finished. Edit: Lvl 12 and the numbers to upgrade are all out of whack and not worth playing. The grind is painstaking.

Dear Commander, thank you for your review.

data.text: Fun to begin with. But the difficulty ramps up so fast you can't progress after a certain level. And the 8 hours you get to defuse the bomb to unlock that one character isn't nearly enough. You get all wires cut except one because the strength requires to earn the final wire cutter just isn't enough by the time runs out. It'sfalse hope unless you "pay to win".....

They got me. It's pretty fun at first, then the GRINDING dude. I'll save you some frustration and a few bucks: you will make progress for 3-5 "blocks", then you will get stuck with an enemy that is way too strong. You will go back to the world map and grind your buns off gathering exp and upgrading various structures for 3-36 hours until you can level up enough to beat the guy you're stuck at. Repeat for life I guess. If you are open to spending a LOT of money, I think this game could be fun.

data.text: I just don't get it. It has potential to be a good game but fails to make much sense. I downloaded it cause it says it's a stickman esk scrolling game. But only a small fraction of the game is of that. The rest is just base building. To get anywhere as far as actual progression you have to spend money. And it's not cheap. It's Almost like this game was made by a scientologist. The only way to move forward is to spend a lot of money. I've spent two weeks two get past level 50 and can not.

data.text: Not at all like the ads. The ad shows rows of bad guys nearing you w/ the # of hits needed to destroy. It looks like a strategic game of needing to make quick thoughts to fire at the right #'s attacking you w/ the assumption that clearing levels will level you up as it gets harder. It is more like a futuristic version of the recently renamed Rise of Castles. The ad merely shows a small part of the game you can rarely even play. Months of play and that small part has never looked like the ad.

data.text: Totally misleading advertising. The pics show a front scrolling game with shooting and this game is a base building game where you grind to increase levels. You can't even play the front scrolling shooter part except for in special operations which u can't access unless u level up. It's also top down and not front scrolling. Please update your ads and pictures to match actual gameplay.

data.text: Pay to win garbage. Mostly a city builder with a few run and gun parts. After about a week the upgrade times for anything become absolutely ridiculous. Additionally, the top 5 Alliances all have a non-aggression pact and only beat up only new guys just trying to get off the starting block. You'll get raided over and over until your base is destroyed. I ruins any fun of the game. If you choose to play, don't spend any money unless and until these issues are resolved.

data.text: This game is great. Easy to play and learn. The serious complaint I have is the troop training times kill your play time. I'm considering quitting the game over it. If you lose your troops in battle it takes 14 hours to retrain 1/4 of your total troops count. It's the worst thing ever. You literally can hardly play for 2-4 days as you rebuild troops. And if you get attacked and lose troops again. There is another 2-4 days. They need to reduce troop training times. 8 hours max to have full troops

data.text: After every update I can't login back in to the game. I have to uninstall and reinstall the game multiple times over to counter this glitch; after this last update I've tried 15 times in a row. After putting in so much time into this game, this is heart wrenching. And the support, trash.

data.text: Every other review is telling the truth. Its a bad cashgrab type game using AI created images as bases for all character portraits. You will not succeed if you don't pay money, because the gameplay after the tutorial phase is just a contest of who has the bigger wallet. On top of all of that, there are misleading "deals" which prompt you to buy things that you ultimately didn't want, such as the "builder queue pack" which does not grant a new build queue slot but instead gives a booster unit.

data.text: Game sucks it tries to get you to buy stuff every time u load it up with an ad and it has stuff built in all over for you to pay. Response to their reply. data.text: Fun ... Addictive ... EXPENSIVE! As many have pointed out, it's a great game that will hook you quick, but if you want to get anywhere or even survive, get ready to grind and spend $. I would gladly give this game more stars, which would be deserved, if they changed a few aspects. Stop charging so much Gold for EVERYTHING! If I'm already spending all of my EXP, Steel, etc, don't take all my gold! Reduce the wait time for free Stamina, and give us better options to collect it on our own.

data.text: The game starts off really good, then the bugs start happening. There is no support for the game, you cantact them and you get a standard auto reply. When you start moving up in levels items you win or are gifted stop showing up forcing one to pay to advance with the team. Contacted support many times and never got a reply. I am glad it didn't happen once money was invested. I would not recommend this game to anyone.

data.text: The premise of the game is fun, why 1 star? Because it is another pay to win with a billion micro transactions, you'll have to pay (a lot) if you want any progress. In the beginning, you can progress fast, but then you'll get stuck and having to wait a collective of long hours to upgrade anything is pretty much unplayable.

data.text: This game is barely like any of it advertisement that spam many social media sites/apps. It is just another "build" a base and endlessly upgrade buildings that take hours to complete. This is just a micro transaction scummy business model with some "loot box" mechanics built in. The game is only really worth playing during it's "tutorial" phase where it is most like that advertisements, assuming you thought that kind of a game could be interesting.

Sad and expensive. You can buy your way to the top. Many balance issues in vs. One guy level 30 can lay waste to your whole team 100+ people, and there is nothing anyone can do. I wish I could get a refund for all the money I have spent. Just to get a base skin cost 400 dollars, and the mini game you play to get tickets is rigged. I have never gotten from the boxes more than one ticket at a time. The whole system works against you to get you to spend money. Just another day before scam

data.text: Awesome game with one major drawback that sucks the fun out of it. Players who spend the money and control the servers rule and dictate the game to everyone else. Right now we have a powerful alliance who without spending thousands of dollars no one will ever touch and they run rough shot on everyone. How do u solve this problem? Maybe the game makers should make it more interesting by having the ability to combat even the players who paid the most from time to time in some form. So lopsided now
data.replyText: Dear Commander, we are striving to improve our gameplay for all players and would greatly appreciate if you could contact us via our in-game support to leave us feedbacks or suggestions, thank you in advance!

data.text: Despite the advertisements for this game promoting it as "the real game shown in the ads", its core gameplay is not how the game is presented. I have played for around an hour now, and the main mechanic here is base building. True, the "horde wave" gameplay is present, but it's only used as a mini game to clear more space to build your base. As others have said, there is a very clear pay to win system here. The game itself is alright if you enjoy base builders, but it is not as advertised.

Not enough of the advertised mini game. It's a build up strategy game not the advertised shootem. Still fun but you definitely need to find a good alliance. The price point is insanely high. Probably too high to be sustainable. Maybe if there was a trading and selling feature of purchased items to other players. Would be a good addition. *ETA: besides the power scaling being busted, the character DVA's critical hit stats are wrong. Should be higher based on her 3rd skill. 2-star review now.
data.replyText:
Dear Commander, glad to hear that you're enjoying our game!
We are striving to improve our gameplay for all players and would greatly appreciate if you could contact us via our in-game support to leave us feedbacks or suggestions, it will greatly help us to optimize our game in the future, thank you in advance!

data.text: False advertisement!!! Battling through zombies with math problems is only part of the game. Initially, that's how they hook you. You build stuff, and battle for upgrades. But you plateau quickly, and either need to wait long periods or pay actual cash to proceed at a reasonable rate.

data.text: The game is ok. My major issue with it 1st it's glitchy. And some are small things but they mess with the esthetic of the game. 2nd is a money issue. Real life money issue. They tend to doubt charge for packs you buy and don't like refunding that second charge. There has been occasions where they have changed when you never purchased anything. If you try to get your back they aren't very help.
data.replyText:
Dear Commander, thank you for the review.
We're sorry to hear that you are experiencing issues in game. Our customer service is working hard to reply to all queries from everyone so apologies for the delayed response. Please contact our game support again and we'll get back to you as soon as we can thank you!

data.text: Game that is somewhat fun, different than ads, and has whales that spend a lot of money so they can bully you (destroy your base). You really have to like building a base and the grind (building upgrades take longer and longer the better you get). There are a lot of people that spend a lot of money on the game, and they can just destroy you in the game. Also lots of bugs(like spending in game free gems and not getting items as well as from fight zombies). Customer support non-existent.
data.replyText:
Dear Commander, we're sorry to hear you are experiencing issues in game.
Please contact our in-game support or via email at lastwar.dev@gmail.com with your game issue and details (eg UID, time/date of issue, supporting screenshots/video references) and we'll assist to check it out.

data.text: I downloaded it, the mini games in the games are similar to the ads they have. There are packs for you to purchase but they aren't necessary. This game is pretty much a more animated version of Guns of Glory, there are a lot of similarities. These types of games aren't new and have been around forever. There are some bugs which make the game worse for others. The biggest one is not every alliance member shows as apart of your alliance and you can attack them, which is straight up unfair.
data.replyText:
Dear Commander, thank you for your review.
We are constantly introducing new events and gameplay for our players so please do look forward to our future game updates!
If you have any suggestions or feedbacks on improving our game we're happy to hear them via our in-game support so do feel free to drop us a mail anytime!

data.text: Besides the prices being overrated in this app, the gameplay itself is good and fun. The times for research and healing or training troops are inadequate as the vs challenges are weekly by the time you are about to heal up another wave of attacks come thru. Everything on the app is very expensive, with little rewards or tresure chest in return. Definitely not happy with the way the gameplay, it forces you to have to make a payment to speed things up.
data.replyText: Dear Commander, we're sorry to hear you had a bad experience. We will strive to improve our gameplay content for our players. Please do look forward to our future game updates! If you have any suggestions or feedbacks for improvement feel free to contact us via in-game support and we'll be happy to hear!

data.text: The game itself is good when ur able to actually play. It takes way too much time to upgrade anything and eventually u lose interest. No game is worth controlling my life waiting around for updates to complete in order to just play. We get games to PLAY them not to focus on upgrading everything under the sun for hours and hours at a time.

data.text: Everything you see in the ads and even in the pictures on its google play page are only from a very small fraction of the game. Something theyll point out as if its not the only reason anyone would download this garbage. Even running those ads trying to claim its not fake. Its just a few bonus missions between the very boring slow game you have to endure. Dont download and dont listen to the ads
data.replyText:
Dear Commander, thank you for your review.

data.text: to the developer's is a beautiful game,love the fun play watching my unit grow. But overall the building experience is rather tedious and unnecessary. im at level 17 trying to strengthen my soldier's and when i upgrade it say's 2 day's and hours for completion thus taking away any futher advancement and the most important part of this game the fun. I'll continue playing until i'll eventually get bored and quit all together. Glad i've still have my game console's and mod's.

data.text: It's addicting. I want to call it a scam, but not exactly one. Free to play, but you probably will get a strong urge to spend money on. It gets you hooked thinking you'll fight zombies and do math, tapping all these things. But, it's more like a mini game of the actual game. You have to make a base and probably fight other bases. Spend so much time to build up troops. The time it takes to do anything takes longer and longer. Like time stops. Nothing to do. Hope you don't fall for it like I did.

Dear Commander, thank you for your review.

Hopefully you will be able to enjoy our new contents!

data.text: A great way to waste your money and time. Like most mobile games, they just force you to tap your screen to make you feel like you're accomplishing something or doing something worthwhile. It says a lot that the name of the game is featured in brackets [Last War] as if they have taken a template for a simple game and attached a new name to it. Immediately they invite you to pay money in order to make "progress" in building your camp and actually name as initial purchase because they expect more.

data.text: the games turns into a constant grind,.there's only about 5 seconds of actually playing the game at a time. The rest is upgrading and farming for supplies. which, if you don't spend lots of money, takes to long. Also, none of the pics or the game play from the ads is actually in the game.

data.text: I like this game. It takes awhile to get higher up. Everything about it, more less have to pay your way to build a higher rank unless you have time to wait for things to finish. Can a game not cost so much money?? Overall it's a good game, but anymore you can't buy a game and just play it like it use to be. These days gotta buy your way through it.

data.text: DO NOT download this. every ad I saw the audio didn't even match up. I'm pretty sure I'm going to hit a point that PVP is a thing too and I'll Uninstall if I stay that long honestly. and it's like 5 second levels and you go back to resource collecting until you hit a point you have to spend real money or sit and wait forever to upgrade. These games should be banned from the store. I get it people need money but it's gotten ridiculous.

Just another Game of War. If the multiplayer aspect were cut out, it'd be decent game, but it's the same ol, 'build your base up so some whale can come in and flatten you.â€™ the ads show nothing of that side. For the simple scroller game mechanic seen in the ads, each lvl is maybe 15 seconds and they're a busy mess lol. Just stinks every game has to be Game of War part deux somehow.

data.text: Started out well enough, but it's basically a pay to play if you want ANY boosters. It's not casual, either. If you don't play at LEAST once a day you're liable to come back to a ruined base. Alliances require far too much time committment, also. Deleting because it's a gimmick with a bunch of people ruining the game acting like 12 year olds with a superiority complex

data.text: 1/5 stars. The ads and screenshots for this game are misleading. It's more of a real time chore/grind base builder, with some elements of the rail shooter mini games they focus on in the ads. I don't want the base builder part at all. I uninstalled as soon as they made me build a base before i could go back to the shootin.
data.replyText:
Dear Commander, we're sorry to hear you had a bad experience.
We hope to improve overall player experience and your feedbacks are greatly appreciated! If you have any suggestions or feedbacks for improvement feel free to contact us via in-game support and we'll be happy to hear them out!

data.text: advert for this game is misleading. this is a base defense game with a very short mini game to gather very little exp and sometimes items. extremely unbalanced pvp interaction, a level 12 player with 176.8k power is allowed to attack a level 4 player with 15.3k power. absolutely no chance of defending unless the attacker chooses to concede. 90% of my resources are gone, so no chance to really upgrade my base or troops. not worth the bandwidth or energy.
data.replyText:
Dear Commander, thank you for your review.
We are striving to improve our overall gameplay experience for all players and would greatly appreciate if you could contact us via our in-game support to leave us feedbacks or suggestions, thank you in advance!

data.text: Not like the ads. Misleading. The sections that do look like the ads and the screenshots have zero affect on the main gameplay which is some Farmville esque base building game. If you lose the "battle" sequences shown in the ads and screenshots, you can retry or skip. Skipping dumps you back to the main game the same as if you successfully completed the "mission". They don't show any of the base building in the ads or the screenshots. It's intentionally misleading.

Once again its just another city building game that they "fail to mention" in the ad. So, false advertisement, which isn't a surprise now days. If you do decide to build the city to play the "those puzzles," you need to build a team and play some other puzzles first. Well, those suck and the team needs the city to get better. You see where this is going. If i could give it zero stars and it count, I would, so it gets 1 star. It's totally a play to win game, of course.

While the game does actually look and somewhat play as advertised, this is a micro transaction game to the max. The leveling up is a grind and the battles become pretty dull after a day or two. It has less to do with decision making on what to shoot down and more to do with if you level up your character. Which is locked behind time walls that require money to speed up and leveling which will also be time drains and or money spent. Overall it's ok, but still feels a bit misleading from as advert
data.replyText: Hello, thank you for the feedback. We will listen carefully to your feedback and keep the game content updated and optimized to continuously improve the game experience. We hope you have a happy game!

data.text: Always the same thing. They show you an ad with something that barely, if at all, exists within the actual game itself, and the person playing it in the ad plays like they're missing all their chromosomes. This is a psychological gambit to get you annoyed enough to download the game so you can play through the same sequence intelligently. But that sequence doesn't exist, it never did. They then turn time into money with a click and wait game like all the others. 1 star for false advertising.
data.replyText: Hello, we are very sorry to bring you a bad game experience. We will listen carefully to your feedback and keep the game content updated and optimized to continuously improve the game experience. We hope you have a happy game!

data.text: It starts out nice and fast with lots of ways to grow your base and people. The biggest problem is to grow each building it takes longer and longer in time. I mean real time. Like hours and when your phone goes in stand by the time stops and picks up where is was when it went in standby. Everything after level takes hours to achieve. You can speed it up but you have to spend hard earned money to do that. No adds which is good but to take 2 hours to upgrade a building is craziness.
data.replyText: Hello, thank you for the feedback. We will listen carefully to your feedback and keep the game content updated and optimized to continuously improve the game experience. We hope you have a happy game!

data.text: Giving three just for the ads on YouTube. Using recycled or outright fake CGI footage is annoying enough. Having the exact same footage reruns narrated by easily excited imbeciles makes them ten times worse. This is a shame, because this is actually a decent game and the beginning gameplay actually looks and works like the ads. Yeah, it's yet another city builder at the core, but the graphics and the intro gameplay do stand head and shoulders above the usual crapware behind these ads.

Pay for play to the max. This game is very in your face about their want for your cash. In many cases, it seems near impossible if not impossible to reach goals without pay for play. Every aspect has a way to just buy your way ahead instead of playing. This game earns 1 star for how involved it is. There is a lot happening and plenty here to keep you clicking. At least there aren't ads for other games.

Just your standard boring base builder with some run and gun elements. Don't let the commercials fool you. What they show there is not the main part of the game. You'll spend the majority of your time building a bad base, and waiting for timers. Just more of the same. There are much, MUCH better run and gun games than this. And you don't even have to wait for timers or build horrible bases in those. I'm so tired of misleading ads. This one is absolutely egregious.
data.replyText: Hello, we are very sorry to bring you a bad game experience. We will listen carefully to your feedback and keep the game content updated and optimized to continuously improve the game experience. We hope you have a happy game!

data.text: This game is awful- made by the creators of Top War which received a 2.7. This game demonstrates their lack of ability to do this. I was looking for a game as simple and bland as solitaire, which is the only reason I keep it. This game will also fall to about 2.7 or lower. Same graphics as Top War with a much less creative style of play. Just horrible. They said, "How can we create a game to get their money which doesn't require much from us?" They made this.
data.replyText: Hello, we are very sorry to bring you a bad game experience. We will listen carefully to your feedback and keep the game content updated and optimized to continuously improve the game experience. We hope you have a happy game!

data.text: headquarters was quick. Now, the more you upgrade and level up your headquarter, the more time needs to be spend to level up buildings and other parts. Moreover, we can't level up 2 or 3 things simultaneously. When you reach at level 15 or more, it take more than 24 hours to level up. Pathetic. Now the game is getting boring day by day.

data.text: It's not really a game. It is more of a entertainment and money begger. You have little choice on what to build, everything takes forever to build, your troops need to be upgraded every couple of stages, and for that you need to upgrade more and more your base. The graphics are nice, the concept is not too bad, but the game is just another one of its time - banking on its players desire to progress to get them to pay for speed ups and upgrades.

data.text: It's a falsely advertised, very boring, base building game. You'll rush up to lvl 5 and then it's just a slow grind from then on in, waiting for your structures to be built so you can upgrade the HQ, in order to progress further in the game and actually be able to do what the adverts, show you you can do. Or you can waste your money on the usual loot boxes etc.

data.text: It's advertised as a quick pick up & play shooting game but quickly turns into a very slow building game, which takes up ALL of your time. They've used misleading keywords to upgrade for real money & players have already spent over Â£1,000 to have an advantage over others, so if you're looking free to play or even enjoying the game on a budget, you'll soon become frustrated. As of Friday night, they force you to play a 24 hour mode against big spenders and you lose everything you've built

data.text: Repetitive gameplay. In for a couple months, the dynamics within the kingdom is interesting though the servers not so much. same duel event every week, waiting to do tasks for the event. then it expands to older servers. then it expands again. almost like the newer you are the harder it would be. I'd like to see more game play within the one server and different events. Marshall is just a rally on one thing, nothing strategic. If you do invest expect repetition

data.text: Even the ads are saying the gameplay is as advertised. Nope, it's a base builder. Repsonse. I would say some of the minigames are styled like your ads. You show zero gameplay in your ads. I did try your game, it's a time-sink click fest. I would say false advertising, no where do you suggest there are any base building, not one word or picture. data.text: Was enjoying the game, spent money, and now can't log back in. I'm still getting notifications with updates regarding my base, but the system will not log me in. I have been trying to log in since 8 pm yesterday. Especially when I get a notification, I am being attacked and can't even shield! Terrible! Waste of time and money. WTO love you guys!
data.replyText: Dear Commander, please contact our in-game support or via email at lastwar.dev@gmail.com with your account info such as game name/UID and we'll assist to verify your issue thank you!

data.text: The game is very good, exciting and stimulating. I would just like to ask the developers for one thing, to create a hero experience table or calculator. I noticed that there is no exact standard for hero experience per level. For example, I can't know the amount of xp needed to go from level 40 to level 65, this information would be very useful. Grateful.

I would love to see more features in the game, specially building design. Would be nice to have the appearance change when we level them up. Also, I would also like to see some more competitiveness in the game that require skill. The game is mostly who has spent the most, type, skill and strategy have no room to be rewarded.

data.text: I've been playing for last 2 months or less maybe and I wanted to give 5 star but giving 2 stars because one thing that I don't like is the cost of upgrade for heroes. After reaching level 55, it takes more than 1 million cost to go to next level which is absurd and totally unfair. Otherwise I like this game and will post or update my review if I found any other problem.

data.text: I think this game is great except for 2 reasons that drive me crazy. 1. - no matter how good you are you need to pay alot to be a top team 2. - worse part of part 1 is I live in Canada and in the US the packs that are $4.99, $10.99 & $19.99 are $6.99, $13.99 & $27.99 in Canada so I have to spend WAY more to get the same items, massive disadvantage based on location, tax situation and Currency.

data.text: The game started beautifully. But as I move towards higher levels, the time to achieve projects begins to stretch. It's now fallen into frustration. Instead of moving forward uninterrupted, I now have to stop playing for a days in order for the game to catch up with instructions. (And this is only level 20) so I can just imagine how much MORE frustrating it's going to get. SO... ,- I'm already tired of it and I'll uninstall, Too bad

data.text: If you were hoping to play something that looked like what they're showing in those YouTube ads, don't bother. This is mostly just a weird military base-building thing where you have to wait hours for progress to finish unless you pay hundreds of dollars. The actual gameplay where you're running down a road shooting at zombies is just a TINY part of this mess. Your choices don't have any impact on if you win or lose; the game already decides that for you. Pay up or lose the level every time.

data.text: Good for about 2 days then it takes far too long to upgrade the buildings, heroes and skills research to be able to progress past levels (can take days to upgrade HQ). Constant attacks from other players deplete slow to gather resources with no way to stop other players from stealing your stuff (should not be attacked if not in an alliance). It is a clear design to get you interested initially and then try to get as much money from you as possible. Must be prepared to pay to win, and pay a lot.
data.replyText:
Dear Commander, thank you for your review.
We hope to improve overall player experience and your feedbacks are greatly appreciated! If you have any suggestions or feedbacks for improvement feel free to contact us via in-game support and we'll be happy to hear them out!

data.text: Captivating. But... With bugs. Also misleading advertisement. It's more a strategic game. With less than 5% of the promised game. With many mission you'll not be able to complete... Unless you pay. Pay for extra resources, to speed up building smth, ...you name it. Unlimited options to pay. The good part - no ads from other games. The bad - passive aggressive tech support. I've reported bugs & got denial - no problem, no evidence & it's your problem.

One of the most predatory games in terms of micro transactions that I have played, if you don't want to spend money then progress is extremely long winded and beyond frustrating. There's literally a daily task to buy something from them. I would avoid in future. There are some neat ideas here and the gameplay is initially fun, but it won't last, not unless you want to empty your bank account to progress

data.text: Advertised as a scrolling run & shoot action game, but quickly changes to a very slow base building game pushing ingame purchases. Only a few of the advertised run/shoot levels are available for each base level upgrade, with no replay, or 'for fun' options. Instead you have to wait days for the build timers tick down before gaining access to the next few levels.

data.text: Nice game, but like others said after 2 days or so it gets tedious. The upgrade timers are just too long and take out the fun of the game. I also expected a simpler game. I thought I'll just run the troops through levels shooting and going through the upgrade gates. In the end, this is something where you need to upgrade a base, harvest stuff (for no clear reason) and upgrade heros etc. I'm just not into that.

data.text: Edit: Generic trash reply by Dev. That's an uninstall. "Oh, its just like the ads" - every ad they have. It's not. It's false advertising. They did everything they could to make it look like the ad while having it be completely different. Levels in the ad are 30 seconds long minimum. Levels here? 5 - 10. You can't amass an army or anything. When you're done that, you get to play a population sim game. Nothing like the ads. Deceitful, but the game makers are already aware of that.

Dear Commander, we're sorry to hear you had a bad experience.

data.text: The ads for this do not represent the game... there is a similar mini game but its still not the same as the ads. The main issue is the extreme pay to win, small upgrades bring huge advantages and the top players are wasting literally 10's of thousands, they are in the same 'world' as you, you cannot avoid them and due to the fully automated battles with zero skill input, you have absolutely no chance to win. You win this game by uninstalling or not installing to start with.

data.text: I thought this game is going to be a game where you can idly play, some "braindead" types of game you know. But there's surprisingly a lot of mechanics. Heroes, bases, foods, irons, etc. You might be into this type of things. But I just see this as another layer for people to pay for some "progress". This is not the game that I wanted. But clearly a lot of effort was put into these, the art and models are great, animations are surprisingly nice too. But, this is just too much for me.

data.text: The advert doesn't reflect the game. It's one of those games where you have to constantly build build build and make in app purchases to get anywhere. AVOID. In response to the message they've sent here, I double down on my review. I'd add that many of the players I came across are a little demented and take the game WAY too seriously. Some even asked why I wasn't spending money!

data.text: Boring... It was fun in the very beginning... But there's no unified coin, very bad interface to know heroes tickets, diamonds, golden coins and whatsoever, there's also the stalker woman that brings something every minute to say "hello" 1. The interface must have less fullscreen dialogs. 2. A retractable toolbar also is a must. 3. The "economy" must be in one screen for better management. 4. Zero popups, instead is better to put a notification bar on the top of screen. For now, that's it.

data.text: I was charged twice for a one time purchase! Now you're blocking me from playing because the second payment was refunded to me! This is insane behavior and I will not pay twice for the same thing! Shamefully to block me from playing now, unless I pay you??! After waiting all day and multiple attempts to get anyone from customer support to help me, no one is coming back to me!
data.replyText: Dear Commander, please contact our in-game support or via email at lastwar.dev@gmail.com with your account info and details (eg UID, purchase receipt screenshots) and we'll assist to verify as soon as we can thank you in advance!

data.text: Appears fun at first, but typical grindy manipulative mechanics filled game. It is good if you have self control and patience, not common in multi-player alliance driven games, and are there for the alliance aspect. Terrible if you want the game play shown in the most common ads, which I got to do a whopping 38 levels of before reaching my grinding and frustration limit, since that part is locked behind exponentially increasing progression requirements of the main gameplay, base building.
data.replyText:
Dear Commander, thank you for your review.
We are constantly introducing new events and gameplay for our players.
Please do look forward to our future game updates!
If you have any suggestions or feedbacks for improvement feel free to contact us via in-game support and we'll be happy to hear them out!
